alert.note: Alert for Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; North Sevier; Northwest Cocke; Sevier Smoky Mountains (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:49PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jefferson, southwestern Cocke and northeastern Sevier Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Sevierville, moving northeast at 20 mph. Outflow winds are occurring ahead of this thunderstorm. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport, Pittman Center, Chestnut Hill, Cosby, Bird Crossing, Hartford, Fairgarden and Waterville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; North Sevier; Northwest Cocke; Sevier Smoky Mountains
